conclusion: Analyze movement of triangle loop in magnetic field to find maximum induced electromotive force.
Depicts equilateral triangle loop labeled CDE moving into uniform magnetic field with side CD perpendicular to MN.
Loop is an equilateral triangle with side length a.
Loop moves into magnetic field with side CD perpendicular to MN.
Calculate area S of triangle loop: S = (sqrt(3)/4) a^2.
Induced electromotive force E is given by Faraday's law: E = -dΦB/dt.
Magnetic flux ΦB = BS through the loop.
Rate of change of magnetic flux: dΦB/dt = B dS/dt.
Loop moves with constant speed v to the right.
Area change rate: dS/dt = (sqrt(3)/4) a v.
Substitute area change rate into expression for E: E = B (sqrt(3)/4) a v.
Maximum value of induced electromotive force as loop enters magnetic field.
